pageContext.claim: “I said to Tim Cook a long time ago, 'Tim, it’s wonderful, Apple — it’s nice — but we want you to build the places here.' And he said, because of our tax, because of what we’ve done, they’re bringing in — they’re actually bringing in about $240 billion, but they’re going to be investing $350 billion on new plants and a tremendous campus and lots of other things.”
pageContext.analysis: This is a stretch. Apple says it is making a one-time tax payment of $38 billion to repatriate around $250 billion in overseas profit because the corporate tax rate was reduced. But Cook has said much of Apple's $350 billion total U.S. investment over five years would have proceeded with or without the tax cuts.
